metadata.title: CVE-2022-2861 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Inappropriate implementation in Extensions API in Google Chrome prior to104.0.5112.101 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install amalicious extension to inject arbitrary scripts into WebUI via a craftedHTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2861` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 104.0.5112.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 104.0.5112.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 104.0.5112.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 104.0.5112.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 104.0.5112.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '104.0.5112.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
